name: 9mm Pistol
description: A standard semi-automatic handgun popular with police and criminals alike. Reliable, concealable, and easy to maintain. May retest one Firearms challenge per session if cleaned after use.
notes: Legal with permit; easily concealed under a jacket.

name: .38 Revolver
description: A classic six-shot revolver. Reliable but slow to reload. Often found in pawnshops or carried by older enforcers.
notes: Legal with permit; limited ammo capacity.

name: Sawed-Off Shotgun
description: A double-barrel shotgun cut down for concealment and intimidation. Devastating up close but wildly inaccurate past a few yards.
notes: Illegal modification; extremely loud and obvious when fired.

name: Baseball Bat
description: A classic aluminum or wooden bat, useful both in sports and in street disputes. Grants a retest on one Brawl challenge per scene.
notes: Legal; conspicuous to carry around at night.

name: Combat Knife
description: A military-style knife with a sturdy grip and serrated edge. Useful for both combat and practical survival tasks.
notes: Legal to possess but illegal to conceal in most jurisdictions.

name: Switchblade
description: A spring-loaded folding knife often carried for self-defense or intimidation. Quick to draw, easy to hide.
notes: Illegal to carry concealed in most states; popular in gang circles.

name: Crowbar
description: Heavy steel bar used for prying open doors or windows. Provides +1 on any Strength-based challenge involving forced entry.
notes: Common tool; doubles as improvised weapon.

name: Lockpick Set
description: A small pouch of tension wrenches and picks. Grants a retest on one Security challenge per scene when used.
notes: Possession without locksmith license may be considered intent to burglarize.

name: Flashlight (Maglite)
description: A durable police-style flashlight providing strong illumination. Grants +1 to Perception challenges in darkness when functioning.
notes: Doubles as club in emergencies.

name: Kevlar Vest
description: A ballistic vest rated to stop most handgun rounds. Reduces incoming ballistic damage by 1 level per attack, up to 3 times per night.
notes: Hot to wear in desert heat; legal for civilians with no felony record.

name: Motorcycle Jacket
description: Heavy leather jacket with padding. Reduces bashing damage by 1 level per hit from melee attacks. Also adds style points.
notes: Common among bikers and Brujah neonates.

name: Police Scanner
description: A handheld VHF/UHF receiver tuned to emergency frequencies. Grants +1 to Awareness or Investigation challenges involving police activity.
notes: Legal to own but illegal to use while committing a crime.

name: Pager
description: A small beeper allowing numeric or short text messages. Standard tool of 1990s nightlife professionals and dealers.
notes: Requires active subscription; discreet but limited.

name: Car Phone
description: A bulky cellular phone mounted in a vehicle. Allows voice calls on the move, though coverage in the desert is unreliable.
notes: Expensive and conspicuous; status symbol in 1995.

name: Laptop Computer (Compaq LTE)
description: A mid-1990s portable computer with monochrome screen and floppy drive. Useful for data storage and hacking with proper skills.
notes: Heavy and slow; battery life under two hours.

name: Handheld Tape Recorder
description: A small cassette recorder used for note-taking or collecting evidence. Grants a retest on one Investigation challenge involving recorded conversation.
notes: Standard journalist tool; tapes can be used as blackmail evidence.

name: Handcuffs
description: Steel police-issue restraints. Used to detain or immobilize targets. Requires a Strength or Security challenge to escape.
notes: Illegal to use outside law enforcement without cause.

name: Duffel Bag
description: Large canvas bag for carrying multiple items or concealing weapons. Allows the user to carry 3 additional encumbering items without penalty.
notes: May attract suspicion if carried into upscale locations.

name: Biker Helmet
description: Full-face motorcycle helmet offering solid protection against impacts. Reduces one level of bashing damage from head strikes or crashes.
notes: Legal and encouraged; muffles hearing slightly.

name: Zippo Lighter
description: A metal refillable lighter. Can ignite small fires or light cigarettes with style. Useful for intimidation or limited pyrotechnic tasks.
notes: Requires lighter fluid; symbol of status among chain-smokers and anarchs.

name: Blood-Tinted Amulet
description: A small copper amulet filled with dried blood. Grants +1 to defense against minor supernatural attacks once per scene.
notes: Carries a faint scent of iron; ritual must be renewed weekly.

name: Cactus Thorn Dagger
description: A thin dagger tipped with a preserved desert cactus thorn, lightly enchanted to cause extra discomfort. +1 to intimidation checks when used.
notes: Fragile; breaks if used for heavy strikes.

name: Desert Sand Pouch
description: A small cloth pouch of sand from a sacred desert site. When spread, highlights recent foot or hand prints and faint magical traces.
notes: Pouch must be kept dry; loses effectiveness after rain or heavy humidity.

name: Silver Mirror Shard
description: A broken shard from a ceremonial silver mirror. Can reveal illusions or disguised creatures when held up to the eye.
notes: Only works if user gazes intentionally; may reflect harmful magics back.

name: Vial of Desert Night
description: A tiny vial of dark liquid that, when applied to the skin or clothing, dims shadows around the user. +1 to Stealth rolls at night.
notes: Effect lasts one hour; may cause faint dizziness in some.

name: Burned Tarot Card
description: A single scorched card from an old tarot deck. Provides a +1 bonus to mental rolls when seeking insight about the future.
notes: Single use per scene; destroyed after a reading.

name: Ashes of the Fallen
description: A small vial of ashes from a ritual pyre. Can be used to enhance Blood Magic or minor rituals, adding +1 to Occult tests.
notes: Highly regulated in certain vampire sects; toxic if inhaled.

name: Cracked Obsidian Coin
description: A small coin etched with runes. Grants the holder temporary sway in minor negotiations (+1 Social), once per encounter.
notes: Works only in low-level street dealings; useless against powerful Kindred.

name: Charred Bone Charm
description: A small bone burned in a protective ritual. +1 to defense against one supernatural effect per scene.
notes: Must be recharged weekly by fire ritual.

name: Vine-Wrapped Staff
description: A short wooden staff wrapped with thorny vines. Grants +1 to Occult or Brawl challenges when performing a ritual or intimidating enemies.
notes: Thorns may injure the user if misused.

name: Moonlit Candle
description: A white candle infused with moonlit oil. Enhances meditation and minor spellcasting, granting +1 Mental rolls during rituals.
notes: Must be lit in darkness; extinguishes easily in wind.

name: Chalk Sigil Set
description: Set of colored chalks for drawing protective or binding sigils. Provides +1 to Security or Occult checks when properly applied.
notes: Sigils fade in 24 hours; requires preparation time.

name: Rusted Iron Necklace
description: Old iron necklace imbued with warding rituals. Protects wearer from minor curses (+1 Occult defense).
notes: Corrodes over time; loses effect if exposed to water.

name: Smoked Glass Vial
description: Contains rare desert herbs and crushed minerals. Can be used to brew potions granting temporary bonuses to Stealth or Investigation.
notes: Single-use; potion preparation requires Occult check.

name: Sigil Tattoo Kit
description: Temporary tattoo ink and stencils. Tattoos grant minor bonuses (+1) to a single Attribute or Ability for 24 hours.
notes: Effect fades naturally; misuse may cause burns.

name: Nightshade Oil
description: A dark oil extracted from toxic plants. Can coat a blade or surface; causes 1 lethal damage if successfully applied.
notes: Toxic to user if mishandled; requires Occult check to safely apply.
